info.title: Hub API Endpoints
info.description:
We have open endpoints that you can use to retrieve information from the Hub as well as perform certain actions such as creating model, dataset or Space repos. We offer a wrapper Python client, [`huggingface_hub`](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface_hub), and a JS client, [`huggingface.js`](https://github.com/huggingface/huggingface.js), that allow easy access to these endpoints. We also provide [webhooks](https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/webhooks) to receive real-time incremental info about repos. Enjoy!

The base URL for those endpoints below is `https://huggingface.co`. For example, to construct the `/api/models` call below, one can call the URL [https://huggingface.co/api/models](https://huggingface.co/api/models)

tags.name: auth
tags.description: The following endpoints get information about your currently used user based on the passed token.

tags.name: models
tags.description: Get information from all models on the Hub.

tags.name: datasets
tags.description: Get information from all datasets on the Hub.

tags.name: sql-console
tags.description: Get information from SQL Console embeds from a dataset.

tags.name: discussions
tags.description: The following endpoints manage discussions.

tags.name: spaces
tags.description: Get information from all Spaces on the Hub.

tags.name: repo-search
tags.description: The following endpoints help get information about models, datasets, and Spaces stored on the Hub.

tags.name: repos
tags.description: The following endpoints manage repository settings like creating and deleting a repository.

tags.name: users
tags.description: User accounts are the base authoring entity on the Hub

tags.name: orgs
tags.description: The following endpoints let you interact with Hub Organizations and their members.

tags.name: jobs
tags.description: The following endpoints manage jobs.

tags.name: resource-groups
tags.description: The following endpoints manage resource groups. Resource groups are a Team or Enterprise feature.

tags.name: papers
tags.description: The following endpoint gets information about papers.

tags.name: collections
tags.description:
Use Collections to group repositories from the Hub (Models, Datasets, Spaces and Papers) on a dedicated page.

You can learn more about it in the Collections [guide](https://huggingface.co/docs/hub/collections). Collections can also be managed using the Python client (see [guide](https://huggingface.co/docs/huggingface_hub/main/en/guides/collections)).

tags.name: notifications
tags.description: The following endpoints fetch Hub notifications.

tags.name: inference-providers
tags.description: Run inference from one of our inference providers.

tags.name: inference-endpoints
tags.description: Manage inference endpoints.

tags.name: mcp
tags.description: The following endpoints are for use with the MCP server.

tags.name: oauth
tags.description: The following endpoints are for use with OAuth.

tags.name: docs
tags.description: The following endpoints are for interacting with the Hub's documentation.

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: The following endpoints are for use with webhooks.

tags.name: scim
tags.description:
Use the SCIM API to control and manage your hub Enterprise organization manage members' access.
## Authentication

- Must be organization owner
- Use Access token with write permission on organization
- Organization must be Enterprise Plus

## Key Attribute Matching

- Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD)
	* SAML: `http://schemas.microsoft.com/identity/claims/objectidentifier`
	* SCIM: `externalId`
- Other Identity Providers
	* SAML: `NameID` or `unique identifier`
	* SCIM: `externalId`

## Supported SCIM User Attributes

| Attribute | Description |
|---|---|
| `userName` | Username for the user |
| `name.givenName` | First name |
| `name.familyName` | Last name |
| `emails` | Array of user emails; we don't support email types |
| `externalId` | IDP provider's unique identifier |
| `id` | Hugging Face SCIM endpoint identifier |
| `active` | Boolean for provisioning status |

delete.description: Delete notifications, either by specifying discussionIds or by applying to all notifications with search parameters

get.summary: Get the MCP tools for the current user

200.description: The MCP tools for the current user

patch.description: Update notification settings for the user

prepaidAmount.description: To be provided when enabling launch_prepaid_credits

patch.description: Update watch settings for the user. Get notified when discussions happen on your watched items.

claimAuthorId.description: Author entry on the paper being claimed.

targetUserId.description: HF user who should receive the claim.

200.description: Paper authorship claim result, including the claimed paper id

get.description: Export the audit log events in JSON format for a Team or Enterprise organization. The export is limited to the last 100,000 events.

Content-Disposition.description: The filename of the exported audit log

get.description:
Get all resource groups the user has access to.

Requires the org to be Enterprise

200.description: Resource groups the user has access to

post.description:
Create a new resource group in the organization.

Requires the org to be Enterprise

get.description:
This endpoint returns a JSON with the avatar URL for the organization.

If called with the `Sec-Fetch-Dest: image` header, it instead redirects to the avatar URL

schema.description: Redirect to the avatar url instead of returning it

get.description: Get a list of members for the organization with optional search and pagination.

verifiedEmail.description: The user's SSO email, if the org has a Team or Enterprise plan and the requester is an admin

Link.description: Link header for pagination, can contain a `rel="next"` link

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all organization members who have been set up, including disabled users. If you provide the filter parameter, the resources for all matching members are returned.

type.description: We only support work emails, other types are converted to work

schema.description: You can filter results using the equals operator (eq) to find items that match specific values like `id`, `userName`, `emails`, and `externalId`. For example, to find a user named Bob, use this search: `?filter=userName%20eq%20Bob`

post.description: Creates a new user in the organization. If the user already exists, only `active` field will be updated to provision the user.

userName.description: Username for the user, it should respect the hub rules: No consecutive dashes, No digit-only, Does not start or end with a dash, Only dashes, letters or numbers, Not 24 chars hex string

type.description: We only support work emails, other types are converted to work

get.description: Retrieves a SCIM user by their ID.

type.description: We only support work emails, other types are converted to work

patch.description:
Modify individual attributes using Operations format. Just provide the changes you want to make using add, remove (only `externalId` is supported), or replace operations.
 If you set `active` to `false`, the user will be deprovisioned from the organization. 
Complicated SCIM `path` values are not supported like `emails[type eq 'work'].value`.
patch.summary: Update an attribute of a SCIM user

type.description: We only support work emails, other types are converted to work

put.description: Updates a provisioned user, you'll need to provide all their information fresh - just like setting them up for the first time. Any details you don't include will be automatically removed, so make sure to include everything they need to keep their account running smoothly. Setting `active` to `false` will deprovision the user from the organization.

userName.description: Username for the user, it should respect the hub rules: No consecutive dashes, No digit-only, Does not start or end with a dash, Only dashes, letters or numbers, Not 24 chars hex string

type.description: We only support work emails, other types are converted to work

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of all organization groups. If you provide the filter parameter, the resources for all matching groups are returned.
get.summary: Get a list of SCIM groups

post.description: Creates a new group in the organization. The group name must be unique within the organization.

get.description: Retrieves a group by its ID. If you provide the `excludedAttributes` parameter, the `members` attribute is not returned.

put.description: Updates a group by its ID. The group name must be unique within the organization.

patch.description: Updates individual attributes using Operations format. Just provide the changes you want to make using add, remove (only `members` is supported), or replace operations.
patch.summary: Update attributes of a SCIM group

get.description: Get information about the user. Only available through oauth access tokens. Information varies depending on the scope of the oauth app and what permissions the user granted to the oauth app.

isPro.description: Whether the user is a Pro user

canPay.description: Whether the user has access to billing. You should check `canPay` first.

billingMode.description: Whether the user is on prepaid or postpaid billing

securityRestrictions.description: Current security restrictions for accessing data in this organization with current authentication method

gitAttributes.description: Provide this parameter if you plan to modify `.gitattributes` yourself at the same time as uploading LFS files. Note that this is not needed if you solely rely on automatic LFS detection from HF: the commit endpoint will automatically edit the `.gitattributes` file to track the files passed to its `lfsFiles` param.

gitIgnore.description: Content of the .gitignore file for the revision. Optional, otherwise takes the existing content of `.gitignore` for the revision.

oid.description: The oid of the blob if it already exists in the repository. If the blob is a LFS file, it'll be the lfs oid.
